Details: Uses recurrent neural networks (RNN) that claim to substantially improve single-read and consensus accuracy
Evaluates short-read alignment tools (i.e. STAR, Tophat2, Hisat2, bbmap, gmap) for long read alignment

Uses 3 layers of quality assessments; (1) basic statistics of the data, including read length, alignment and coverage across all chromosomes; (2) error pattern analysis if a reference genome is provided; (3) transcript-related statistics if a gene annotation is provided.  AlignQC takes the standard BAM format file as the input, outputs XHTML format file for easy visualization, and provides links to access all analysis results.
Uses hybrid and debruijin graphs
A genomic scaffolder aimed at synthetic long read and read-cloud sequencing technologies
Scaffolding genome assemblies
An improved consensus model (phase out of Quiver) based on a more straightforward hidden Markov model approach
Tested on abyss, Celera, Velvet and SSAKE. Concludes saying that OLC can be considered as a favourable algorithmic framework for the development of assembler tools for Nanopore-based data
Compares Albacore, Guppy, Scrappie, deepnnano, Chiron
Tools for optimizing and quality checking performance of basemods and related tools on PacBio Data
For tidying the PromethION outputs and visualising the data
Computational pipeline for calling consensi on R2C2 nanopore data

Detect overlaps in high-noise sequences using MHAP. Generate corrected sequence consensus. Trim corrected sequences. Assemble trimmed corrected sequences. Takes all-vs-all read self-mappings (typically by minimap) as input and outputs an assembly graph in the GFA format. Different from mainstream assemblers, miniasm does not have a consensus step. It simply concatenates pieces of read sequences to generate the final contig sequences. Thus, the per-base error rate is similar to the raw input reads.
A deep learning CNN+RNN+CTC structure to establish end-to-end base calling. Built with tensorflow and python 2.7.
Circularizes genome assemblies
Generate isoform-based alignments and exon-based alignments
Utilizes efficient k-mer matching to detect long-read overlaps and must rely heavily on filtering repetitive k-mers for efficiency as all k-mers in all reads are considered.
A pipeline for calling structural variants
Deep learning based Nanopore simulator which can simulate the process of Nanopore sequencing.
An online tool designed to compare two genomes. It supports large genome and you can interact with the dot plot to improve the visualisation
A faster implementation of Nanopolish call-methylation in C
OLC approach
Filter long read data by quality and create a subset of smaller but “better” in quality based on read length and read identity
Combination of de bruijin graph and OLC approach
Reproducibility workflow for Gigante et al., 2018: Using long-read sequencing to detect imprinted DNA methylation
A pipeline for assembling reads and error correcting
It is an OLC(Overlap-Layout-Consensus) assembler

Details: Extracts repeating sequence segments and corrects them by constructing a consensus sequence
Extract signal levels and noise information of DNA bases using a Bayesian model
Mandalorion defines isoforms based on splice site, TSS and polyA site usage

Currently through this model it is possible to get multiple substitutions called at a site, if two non-reference bases both have posterior probability greater than 0.3. Margincaller does not currently report reference base probs
A tool that provides overlapping, patching, correction and assembly of long reads

Combines the benefits of deBruijn graph and Overlap-Layout-Consensus assembly approaches. Since version 3.2.1 it supports hybrid assembly with short Illumina reads and long high error PacBio/MinION data

A binary classifier to improve bacterial base modification N6-methyladenine (m6a) classification by marking adenines as methylated or unmethylated based on differences between measured and expected current values as each adenine travels through the nanopore.
an ultra-fast Mapping, Error Correction and de novo Assembly Tool.

Uses a dimensionality reduction technique named minhash to create a more compact representation of sequencing reads. Originally developed to determine the similarity of web pages, minhash reduces a text or string to a small set of fingerprints, called a sketch.

Takes all-vs-all read self-mappings (typically by minimap) as input and outputs an assembly graph in the GFA format. Different from mainstream assemblers, miniasm does not have a consensus step. It simply concatenates pieces of read sequences to generate the final contig sequences. Thus, the per-base error rate is similar to the raw input reads.
Creates dotplots from minimap2 results
Maps reads to a human genome
Summarise and analyse results for multiple tools and samples in a single report
Error correction tool for ONT data
License: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

Details: A simple error correction method inspired by pbdagcon. Quite slow and other methods have superceeded the capability of this tiool. Hence, it was depriciated.
Bioinformatics pipeline for nanopore sequencing data
A parallel wrapper around the Nanopolish framework
A set of tools developed for visualization and processing of long-read sequencing data from Oxford Nanopore Technologies and Pacific Biosciences.
Provides alignments to any target of interest, alignment statistics and information about polymorphisms
Plotting reads and alignments
Plotting functions of Oxford Nanopore sequencing data
An algorthm to analyse ONT data at signal level
Upstream pre-processing and downstream analysis of nanopolish
UCSC Nanopore group's software pipeline for reference-based sequence analysis
The first algorithm for the identification of modified nucleotides without the need for prior training data along with the open source software implementation.
A set of snakemake pipelines for nanopore whole genome sequencing processing and analysis.
Identifies split- and gapped-aligned reads and clusters the reads according to the orientations and genomic positions of the read segments to define breakpoint-junctions of structural variations
Small test datasets for testing nanopack scripts and modules
Combines Illumina and Oxford Nanopore technologies to produce synthetic aligned reads upto 60kb with no errors and spans repetitive regions
The integration of alignment, polishing, variant calling, SV analysis, etc. In one package
A correction algorithm and assembly strategy that uses short, high-fidelity sequences to correct the error in single-molecule sequences.
Have implemented DAGCon (Directed Acyclic Graph Consensus) which is a sequence consensus algorithm based on using directed acyclic graphs to encode multiple sequence alignment
Considers both intra-read discordance and soft-clipped tails of long reads to identify structural variants.

PacBio's CCS method in SMRT Analysis 2.3 cannot distinguish between the strands of heteroduplex amplicons, so pbssc is a workaround method that is compatible with SMRT Analysis 2.3 and the .bax.h5 files generated from RSII instruments.
A suite of tools to call and analyse structural variants in diploid genomes
Polish structural variants

Annotating genomes using long read transcriptomics data with pinfish
Scripts for plotting nanopolish methylation data
Remove adapters through alignments
Analysis pipeline for functional metagenomic sequencing data obtained using nanopore sequencing
Pipeline for nanopore read alignment and statistics
A signal-level pre-processor for Oxford Nanopore direct RNA sequencing (DRS) data that does alignments with minimap2 and outputs fastq files for further processing.

An R Markdown script designed to run as part of a Nanopore local base calling pipeline. Porequality reads Nanopore sequencing summary files to generate an aesthetically pleasing HTML report to facilitate the visualization of key metrics.
De novo sequence using the discretised ionic current data from an arbitrary number of independent nanopore reads of the same region of DNA
Benchmarking of assembling tools (e.g. Canu, minimap2, for user provided datasets
Provide a python-based toolkit for flexible exploration of minION generated data for the purposes of quality control and downstream analysis.
Tool to identify full length cDNA reads
Computing metrics and generating plots from Oxford Nanopore Albacore report
Evaluating large-scale genome assemblies
Improved version of QUAST
More accurate reads from nanopore sequencing through Rolling Circle Amplification to Concatemeric Consensus method
Trims adapter sequences, retrieves optional UMI's, clusters reads and produces a consensus sequence for each cluster after multiple sequence alignment
Based on David Coffey’s pipeline above
This paper presents one of the first methods able to detect methylation changes directly from Oxford Nanopore long- read sequencing. It can detect three cytosine variants and two adenine variants.

Structural variant (SV) and indel caller for PacBio reads
Uses evidence from split-read alignments, high-mismatch regions, and coverage analysis from sorted alignment outputs of BWA-MEM
Tested on bacterial genome and uses de Bruijn graph approach.

For correcting and aligning long reads with/without a second generation reads, transcript clustering, novel and full-length splice isoform detection, and identification and analysis of polyAdenylation (poly(A)) and alternative poly(A) (APA).
A suite of tools primarily for the identification of modified nucleotides
Assemble Illumina (uses spades), ONT, PacBio (uses miniasm+Racon) or hybrid data for bacterial genomes
A repository of available tools from ONT
Improving draft assemblies and find variants among strains
